ygData.subject: Re: Practicing Wind with Mino Horn
ygData.msgSnippet: It definitely does.  I use a minotaur horn all the time.  I never really had to spefically practice my wind skill.  When I got invisibility, I ended up using
ygData.messageBody:
It definitely does. I use a minotaur horn all the time. I never really
had to spefically practice my wind skill. When I got invisibility, I ended
up using it so much, that it goes up to max each level on its own.

A tip, if you're in a train prone zone, like Mistmoore for example, and
you're in a group that has mana dumpers. When the party is done being
healed up with Hymn, kick in group invisibility. It's saved my party and
my own life on numerous occasions. Of course, this only applies between
levels 19 and 31. (Not that I would know about the latter level...)

Laluni the 26th level bard on E'ci.


At 10:57 PM 9/3/99 GMT, you wrote:
>From: "Jukeboxie the Bard" <jukeboxie@...>
>
>
>Have you been using a minotaur horn, or a flute, hon? When I first hit 16, I
>doubled up on swimming and wind by equipping my wooden flute, jumping in the
>water at the mage guilde in Freeport, firing up Tarew's and going about my
>daily life for a few hours. Got to 81 or so.
>
>The minotaur horn doesn't show the flute animation, but I'd swear it doesn't
>practice wind, either. I tried practicing in the pond in Halas with a horn,
>when afk for a good bit, and saw zero improvement.
>
>What I'm getting at here is this: does the minotaur horn actually use the
>Wind skill? From what I've observed, it doesn't seem to.
>
>-Juke
>
>>From: Talies the Wanderer <snicker@...>
>>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>>Subject: Re: [eqbards] Wind (was: [eqbards] Brass)

>>
>>From: Talies the Wanderer <snicker@...>
>>
>>At 01:39 PM 9/3/99 -0700, you wrote:
>> >From: Ryan Honeyman <slasher@...>
>> >
>> >>*I* still can't figure out how to practice Wind, though
>> >
>> >The Arena + A flute + SSC + 4-8 hours = max wind skill.
>> >
>> >...damn, there is a definite pattern here. hehehhe.
>> >
>> >(of course you have to be level 18 for DDD, and level 19 for SSC)
>> >
>>
>>Ah - that was my problem - I'm still 18th ;)
>>
>>Talies
